comments:
I have tried to run "eclipse-SDK-3.0-aix-motif.zip" as well as
"eclipse-SDK-3.1M1-aix-motif.zip" on an AIX 5.2 machine. But both do not get
further than the splash screen.

We have a 64bit AIX PPC machine. I first tried with the 64bit Java JREs from
IBM. Then I also tried the 32bit version, both failed, with different errors.

uname -a:
  AIX <somename> 2 5 000692084C00
oslevel -r:
  5200-03

In the download for Eclipse the following is mentioned:
"AIX Version 5.2: For fileset X11.motif.lib: If service level > 5.2.0.0, you
must apply APAR IY41944"

I tried to verify this and it seems OK (our installed AIX already seems to
comprise APAR IY41944). But I am not 100% sure about it.

I have no admin privileges on this machine. JRE and Eclipse are installed
privately. But I can use Java without problems otherwise, so I do not think that
this causes the errors.

Here are the errors from the Eclipse logfiles.

This does not seem to be a problem of Eclipse or SWT. I was trying to run
Eclipse on an AIX server and my DISPLAY was set to a Windows XP machine running
"Reflection X", an X Server for Windows or X emulation. The errors described
occurred with that configuration (on AIX!).

Now I got my Linux box and tried to direct the DISPLAY there. Amazingly enough
it works now, at least when I use the 32-bit JRE on AIX. There is still an error
when I use the 64-bit JRE, but then again I am not absolutely sure if this is
really a 64-bit CPU as I was told.

So essentially it works and the errors could have been caused by timing problems
or weird incompatiblities with "Reflection X", not really SWT or Eclipse.
